Please fill and submit the attached Co-op Questionnaire with your application.

A career at ICBC is an opportunity to be part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team that is driven to serve its customers and community. Make the most of your skills and take the opportunity to grow and develop your career. You can expect a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits and a challenging work environment. Drive your career with us. We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers. If you are a job seeker with a disability, please let us know so we can support you in delivering your best performance.


Job Title: Application Development Co-op
Employment Type: Paid Co-op
Location: North Vancouver
Hours of Work: 7.5 hr Day Shift (5 days M-F) (8 days per month or 2 days per week in office)
Pay: $34.23 per hour + 11.2% in lieu of vacation and stat
Duration: 4 months with options to renew


Position Highlights
Working as a member of ICBC's Software Development Lifecycle team, you will be developing and managing solutions used by our Insurance, Claims, or Driver Licensing lines of business. You will work with industry-leading technologies, including SAP, Guidewire's suite and other Java-based platforms and be part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team in an environment that promotes growth and development.

We are looking for a qualified co-op student who will:

Play a supporting role for development teams within IS Claims, Insurance, Driver Licensing or SDLC
Analyze P1 & P2 incidents of applications in production, and assist with post-incident reviews (PIR)
Gather and analyze user requirements for new application functionality
Develop web prototypes, system enhancements, big fixes or automation solutions
Create/update system documentation
Create/modify reporting solutions
Have an ability to work cooperatively within a team environment and other departments to provide support for data integration, data analysis and data visualization


Position Requirements
The ideal candidate will have the following:

Good understanding of client-server and web technologies
Good understanding of Java, .NET/C# (UNIX would be a bonus), and SQL database queries
Good understanding of React, Next.js, SQL & RESTful API design patterns
Experience with cloud service providers such as AWS, Azure.
Good understanding of standard web technologies and libraries (i.e., HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery)
Good understanding of quality assurance practices relating to software development
Experience with version control tools (e.g. GitLab) or creating Git based CI/CD pipelines.
Ability to work cooperatively within a team environment and other departments to provide support for data integration, data analysis and data visualization
Excellent inter-personal skills and communication/presentation skills
Excellent organizational and writing skills
